newsitem.title: JAPAN: Kajima plans straight bond issue--sources.
newsitem.headline: Kajima plans straight bond issue--sources.

text.p: Kajima Corp is considering issuing corporate bonds, several underwriting sources said on Tuesday.
The construction company is likely to issue domestic straight bonds worth about 60 billion yen, one underwriting source said.
"The company is expected to issue four tranches of corporate bonds. They are likely to be five-, six-, seven- and eight-year bonds," he said.
He said the five- and six-year bond issues will be worth about 20 billion yen each while the seven- and eight-year bond issues will be worth 10 billion yen each.
Another source said Kajima was considering issuing domestic straight bonds but had not decided on the details.
